job_title: Porter in Bronx, NY
pros: Pay is ok but not competitive but you have a little freedom as far as it isn’t anyone breathing down your neck
cons: No leadership . Pay is low compared to other companies . You can move up though if you are the shmoozing type .

job_title: Residential Counselor in Bronx, NY
pros: Easy job with a lot of downtime. Good for students.
cons: Doesn't care abt it's employees, Likely will be attacked by a resident. Short-staffed.

review_title: This organization has high levels of integrity
job_title: Front Desk Counselor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: They provide additional trainings to expand your knowledge, no matter what your position is. Everyone has each other's backs. The more effort you put in, the more you receive back.
cons: You may encounter possibly high-risk situations with residents.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Bronx, NY
pros: Residential buildings are small. Most are clean and residents are average difficult
cons: Salary, management, organizational structure, communication

job_title: Case Manager in Bronx, NY
pros: the work can be rewarding.
cons: there seems to be a lot of mismanagement at the top that negatively impacts the whole organization. there's also more of a focus on extracting rent from clients than providing them with fair services.

job_title: Care Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: In the beginning it was good. Bonus and holiday pay. The higher ups at one point care a bit.
cons: Overworked, to many members to a CC or PS. High turnover rates. CEO paying himself, that was in the newspaper.

job_title: Vocational Specialist in New York, NY
pros:
Comfortable introduction to the company, great training and the trainer was friendly, approachable and well informed! 

Started as a vocational specialist, but I’m excited to see where my career goes from there. I feel like there’s more opportunities here than at other companies, so I’m looking forward to investing my time here. 

Overall, it’s a great place to work, laugh and meet some incredible people.
cons: Not the company culture I was expecting, but in a good way… It’s exceeded all my expectations!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Lots to love but what I like most is the lack of micromanagement. I laugh at myself sometimes because I keep expecting to have someone breathing down my neck when I least expect it. I’m just a little gun shy because that’s how it was at the last company I worked for. None of that nonsense here. PCMH has been a good change of pace.
cons: I wouldn’t mind a pay increase sometime down the line. No other actual con to note. Work experience is amazing here.

review_title: A company that just can’t lose
job_title: Residential Counselor in New York, NY
pros: It’s starting to feel like everything PCMH touches turns to gold. I heard the company went through a rough patch just a few years ago, but since I’ve been hired on I’ve experienced nothing but success after success.
cons: I wouldn’t consider anything I’ve experienced with the company a con.

review_title: You’re going to have a good time here
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in New York, NY
pros: When you work with the right guys, you’re going to have a good time. The people I work with are easily the best part about working at PCMH. We joke around and have our fun, but we also know when to keep it professional. Some days are busier than others, but it’s a relaxed job for the most part.
cons: I went into this line of work because I love doing it. That mixed with good people means that there really aren’t any downsides to working here. At least not for me.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros:
I originally began working for the company from home, which I greatly preferred to the job I held before this one. But the position I initially filled here at PCMH, was only a temporary one. When the opportunity to transition to a long-term position came up, I took it and things have only gone uphill since.

My first week in the office was great and it was especially interesting meeting everyone I’d been working with remotely in person. My team is incredibly smart, but they’ve never made me feel like a burden whenever I have questions or need further clarification.
 
After only the second week, I knew this job was going to be the one that stuck. I’ve hopped around in my professional career for the past 5 years or so and I was starting to worry that I had commitment issues. But the work is so close to my home and my past experience and skills fit in so well here, it was like a match made in heaven. After the first few weeks, I'd gotten into a routine, and things felt easy for me. 

Management took the COVID situation very seriously and employee safety was the company’s #1 priority in 2020. Even though it was a tough year, they took it all in stride and we’re better now than we’ve ever been. 2020 was a giant pause for all of us, but since the start of 2021 and the roll out of the vaccines, I’ve been steadily progressing in my career here at PCMH and making serious headway on some of my more long-term career goals. 

I wake up every morning eager to go work. I try to learn as much as I can, and complete my tasks with enthusiasm and passion. I can’t speak for everyone at the company, but I know my closest coworkers feel the same, because if anything, I would say that I got my current attitude towards my job from them. They have an incredible energy that’s infectious in the best way!

My time with PCMH has been fantastic and I couldn’t wish for a better experience overall. I highly recommend this company to anyone considering working here and would only say that it isn’t something to enter into lightly because they have very high expectations and you have to be in a place where you’re not only ready to meet them, but exceed them.
cons: Not a single one. If you join the team and find anything to complain about I can guarantee that you’re the problem, not the company.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY
pros: The moment I joined the team I felt right at home. The culture is warm and welcoming. People will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and management make themselves readily available to accommodate you. The flexible hours work well with my school schedule. I wouldn’t have been able to work here otherwise.
cons: Like I said in the title, the work is rewarding.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros:
The atmosphere at PCMH is great! 
It is a warm and welcoming company that makes you feel right at home when in work. 
The staff and mangers are all very friendly. 
If you are a new to PCMH then they bring you in and act as if you've been there forever. 
At PCMH you are sure to learn life long skills and make life long friends. 
Choosing to work at PCMH is the exact opposite of a mistake!
cons: None. It was just time for me to move on.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: You’ll learn everything you need to know about the industry and then some. My recommendation: don’t pass up on such an amazing learning opportunity.
cons: I can’t think of a single one. I only left because a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity presented itself.

job_title: Field Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Upward Mobility is a plus.
cons: Upward mobility limited to working 1 year in the position. They are firm about the year generally

job_title: Residential Counselor in New York, NY
pros: I've just gotten to 3 years with PCMH and my journey has been amazing. The leaders within this company help build and mold you to become an even greater leader. The growth has been wonderful and I love to see how the company works so hard to give back!
cons: If I had to write something, I guess I’d say communication could be better, especially between the different departments.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Friendly staff, good clients, decent pay, generous benefits, fun company events

job_title: Support Staff in New York, NY
pros: Management holds all staff to a high standard. It’s nothing new or excessive. It’s what you should come to expect from a professional work environment. As long as you treat others like you would want to be treated I guarantee your experience will be positive.
cons: The work load is no joke.

job_title: Residential Counselor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: gained experience and worked with a great group of people.
cons: pay is horrible, constant changes, higher ups are rude to the staff 90% of he time, the ceo pays himself 2 salaries yet staff do not get raises or bonuses, they fire anyone for any reason at any time, saw too many staff crying, racist and will not hire enough staff. they have been sued by clients families for taking money and not having proper care and Medicaid Fraud. the health coverage was so high the staff was applying for welfare. For 1 person you pay $200 for a family you pay $700 a month.  if you call in sick or late forget it.

review_title: A non for profit with management that states otherwise.  Otherwise a good potential to help community.

review_title: Good job for first time Case Managers
job_title: Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: Good stepping stone. Monthly metrocards. Great health insurance. Case Managers are friendly and helpful. Yearly bonus, work cellphone. Great job for people entering the Social Work field.
cons: Upper management likes embarrassing employees. Very untrustworthy coworkers. Doing home visits in the most extreme weathers. Company cares more about how many clients you see a week than you. Paperwork gets lost on a daily basis.

job_title: Care Coordinator in Brooklyn, NY
pros: I have nothing nice to say about this company. I don't like how upper management treats people. They are very unorganized I would never apply again.
cons: Unorganized, no training, not enough money, wrong phone numbers/addresses for clients, they make you pay for items you never received. If you do not give them your charger they threaten to take it out of your check. They don't care if you are sick they want you to put yourself at risk and go to clients houses are sick and have bed bugs.
